Bork, Bork, Bork: Amaretto Chicken	Appetizers	Mains	Sauces	Desserts	Drinks	ð	â	Amaretto Chicken	Serves: 6	Cook time: 45 mins	Ingredients	1 cup	parmessan cheese	3 Tbsp	all purpose flour	1 cup	amaretto	5-10	boneless chicken breasts	2	Tbsp	butter or margarine	2 Tbsp	cooking oil	1 Â½ Tbsp	dijon mustard	6 Tbsp	frozen orange juice concentrate, thawed	1 Â½ Tbsp	garlic powder	2 Tbsp	paprika	1 Â½ Tbsp	pepper	Â½ Tbsp	salt	Steps	Mix all dry ingredients. Coat each chicken breast in dry
mixture. Saute in oil and butter in a skillet, only until brown on
both sides. Remove chicken breasts to a baking dish. Add
the remaining ingredients to the skillet, stirring to deglaze.
Increase heat. Cook until slightly thickened, stirring
constantly. Pour over chicken. Bake at 375 F for 45 minutes.

Bork, Bork, Bork: Blackened Catfish	Appetizers	Mains	Sauces	Desserts	Drinks	ð	â	Blackened Catfish	Serves: 2	Cook time: 1	Cajun	Ingredients	1 tsp	black pepper	1 lbs	catfish	1 tsp	cayene pepper	1 Tbsp	garlic powder	2 Tbsp	olive oil	1 Tbsp	onion powder	1 tsp	oregano	1 tsp	paprika	Â½ tsp	salt	2 tsp	thyme	1 tsp	white pepper	Steps	Place the fish fillets in a large bowl and drizzle olive oil over them, let stand for 30 minutes
Combine spices in a 9-inch pie plate.
Heat a cast iron skillet upside down over high heat for 5 to 10 minutes or until very hot.
Turn on vent fan during cooking to eliminate smoke.
Using a hot pad, turn pan right side up.
Remove fish fillets from oil and drain.
Dip each fillet into seasonings and coat each side evenly.
Put fillets in hot skillet and cook 2 to 3 minutes per side, turning only once.

Bork, Bork, Bork: Croque Monsieur	Appetizers	Mains	Sauces	Desserts	Drinks	ð	â	Croque Monsieur	Fancy pants way of saying grilled ham and cheese sandwhich	Serves: 4	Cook time: 20 mins	French	Ingredients	1 Tbsp	butter	4 slices	cooked ham	1 tsp	dijon mustard	2	eggs	2 cups	grated Gruyere cheese	2 Tbsp	mayonnaise	2 Tbsp	milk	1 Tbsp	oil	8 slices	white bread (thin)	Steps	Cut crusts from bread (optional). Combine cheese, mustard and enough
mayonnaise to make mixture paste-like, make sure mixture is not wet.
Spread mixture thickly on 8 slices of bread. Place slices of ham on 4 slices
of bread, spread with cheese. Cover with remaining slices of bread, cheese
side down.
Beat eggs and milk together. Pour into a shallow pan. Dip both sides of each
sandwich in egg mixture.
Heat oil and butter in large frying pan. Brown sandwiches on each side for 5
minutes or until golden brown.

Bork, Bork, Bork: Plantain Mash	Appetizers	Mains	Sauces	Desserts	Drinks	ð	â	Plantain Mash	Serves: 2	Cook time: 10 mins	sides	Ingredients	3 Â½ oz	butter	2 oz	fresh coriander, chopped	1 tsp	fresh thyme leaves	2 cloves	garlic	3 oz	olive oil	2	plantains	Steps	Preheat the oven to 200C/400F. Peel the plantains, cut into large pieces and

further. When ready, remove the plantains from the oven and mash with a fork.

Bork, Bork, Bork: Shepard's Pie	Appetizers	Mains	Sauces	Desserts	Drinks	ð	â	Shepard's Pie	Serves: 4	Cook time: 30 mins	Ingredients	10 oz	can tomato sauce	1 can	corn	Â½ lbs	ground beef	3-4	potatoes	200 g	shredded cheddar	Steps	Brown the ground beef in a frying pan
While browning the ground beef boil the potatoes (peeled)
When ground beef is ready add tomato sauce and a bit of browning for colouring.	Optionally spice, some of: italian seasoning, sage, pepper and or a bit of cayanne as you see fit.
When potatoes are ready mash intensly or whip
Cover the bottom of a square pyrex with the ground beef, layer the potato on top
Cover the potato with a thin layer of cheese
Broil pie under High setting until cheese bubbles or starts to crisp

Bork, Bork, Bork: Shrimp in butter garlic sauce	Appetizers	Mains	Sauces	Desserts	Drinks	ð	â	Shrimp in butter garlic sauce	Serves: 2	Cook time: 15 mins	Ingredients	4 Tbsp	Butter, unsalted	3 cloves	Garlic	4 Tbsp	Lemon juice	1 lbs	Shrimp	Steps	Crush/chop 3-4 cloves of garlic. Do not slice (doesn't melt into sauce enough).
Put 1 tablespoon of butter into a frying pan and fry the garlic. Once the
garlic is brown, proceed.
If shrimp is not pre-cooked: fry shrimp in the butter and garlic.
Once shrimp is cooked (or pre-cooked), add shrimp, rest of butter to pan. Fry
for about 5 minutes.
(Optional) Add lemon juice
Spice with pepper, parsely, Herbs de Provence or whatever else you like	Notes	Preparation Notes
Defrost shrimp by soaking in cold water for 30 minutes
Variations
Possibly experiment with only 3 Tbsp of butter
Need a lot of parsely if coating in pan, most of it ends up remaining in the sauce
Inste

Bork, Bork, Bork: Steak (oven/seared)	Appetizers	Mains	Sauces	Desserts	Drinks	ð	â	Steak (oven/seared)	Steak done to perfection.	Cooked first then pan seared.	Serves: 1	Cook time: 25 mins	Ingredients	1	pepper	1	salt	1	steak	Steps	Pre-heat oven to 275F
(Optionally) Salt/pepper steaks to taste
Bake steak in oven.	The slow cooking process makes the meat tender.
Cook to the correct core temperature as desired:
Medium Rare 90-95 degrees (20-25 minutes)
Medium 100-105 degrees (25-30 minutes)	Cooking times may vary greatly depending on thickness of steak. 2" steaks can take up to 45 minutes. Watch their temperature as they cook.
Heat oil in a skillet, iron works great, on medium-high heat.
Quickly sear the steaks. Less than 2 minutes per side, again to taste.	Searing seals in the taste and makes the food safe.	By searing after cooking you get a nice thin sear line and cooked perfectly to temperature.

Bork, Bork, Bork: Ziplock Omlettes	Appetizers	Mains	Sauces	Desserts	Drinks	ð	â	Ziplock Omlettes	This isn't so much a recipe as a preparation technique.	Especially useful to
make custom omelletes for individuals and nobody has to wait.
Use whatever ingredients you would normally use in an omellette.	Serves: 1	Cook time: 13 mins	breakfast	Ingredients	2	eggs	Whatever you want in an omlette	Steps	If preparing different omelletes, have each person write their name on a ziploc bag.	Crack 2 eggs into a quart sized ziploc bag, shake to combine them
Add ingredients (e.g: cheese, ham, onion, green peppers, tomato, hash browns, salsa, etc.)
Shake bag to mix ingredients
Make sure all of the air is out of the bag
Place bags in roiling boiling water for 13 minutes.
Cut bags and the omellette will roll out of the bag (careful they'll be hot)

Add water to thin out	Notes	Variations

Rose: add 3-4 tablespoons of tomato paste.
Wine: replace some of the fluid (milk or water) with Â¼ cup of white wine
White pepper can be added for flavour
Garlic: after heating the milk, fry garlic 2-3 cloves of garlic. Add the butter to the garlic once it has browned
